snippet: The entertainment, housing and gambling complex planned for the site of the once-famous Concord hotel is one in a long line of proposals to revive the once-thriving Catskill region.
abstract: Entertainment Properties is set to unveil a plan to build the largest resort in upstate New York in decades, a $600 million entertainment, housing and casino complex on the site of a once-famous resort hotel in the Catskill Mountains of Sullivan County; proposal faces challenges, including lawsuit filed by Westchester County developer Louis R Cappelli, who owns part of the property and says project cannot proceed without his approval.
lead_paragraph: The entertainment, housing and gambling complex planned for the site of the once-famous Concord hotel is one in a long line of proposals to revive the once-thriving Catskill region.

headline.seo: Planned Catskill Resort at Concord Hotel Site Faces Hurdles
headline.main: Planned $600 Million Catskill Resort Faces Suit and Doubts
headline.print_headline: Planned $600 Million Catskill Resort Faces Suit and Doubts
